# areaRadius

**Instance Property**

The radius, in units of local coordinate space, of the area from which light emanates.

## Declaration

```swift
var areaRadius: Float { get set }
```

## Discussion

The effect of radius on a light’s shape depends on the value of its inherited [doc://com.apple.modelio/documentation/ModelIO/MDLLight/lightType] property:

- [doc://com.apple.modelio/documentation/ModelIO/MDLLightType/linear]: The light is shaped like a line segment, centered on the origin of its local coordinate space and extending along the x-axis with a total length of twice the [doc://com.apple.modelio/documentation/ModelIO/MDLAreaLight/areaRadius] value.
- [doc://com.apple.modelio/documentation/ModelIO/MDLLightType/discArea]: The light is shaped like a circle or ellipse in the xy-plane of its local coordinate space. If the [doc://com.apple.modelio/documentation/ModelIO/MDLAreaLight/aspect] value is `1.0`, the [doc://com.apple.modelio/documentation/ModelIO/MDLAreaLight/areaRadius] value is the circle’s radius. If the [doc://com.apple.modelio/documentation/ModelIO/MDLAreaLight/aspect] value is less than one, the [doc://com.apple.modelio/documentation/ModelIO/MDLAreaLight/areaRadius] value is the major radius of the ellipse, and the minor radius is equal to the [doc://com.apple.modelio/documentation/ModelIO/MDLAreaLight/areaRadius] value times the [doc://com.apple.modelio/documentation/ModelIO/MDLAreaLight/aspect] value.
- [doc://com.apple.modelio/documentation/ModelIO/MDLLightType/rectangularArea]: The light is shaped like a rectangle in the xy-plane of its local coordinate space. If the [doc://com.apple.modelio/documentation/ModelIO/MDLAreaLight/aspect] value is `1.0`, the light is a square and [doc://com.apple.modelio/documentation/ModelIO/MDLAreaLight/areaRadius] value is half the square’s width or length. If the [doc://com.apple.modelio/documentation/ModelIO/MDLAreaLight/aspect] value is less than one, the [doc://com.apple.modelio/documentation/ModelIO/MDLAreaLight/areaRadius] value is half the rectangle’s longer dimension, and the shorter dimension is the [doc://com.apple.modelio/documentation/ModelIO/MDLAreaLight/areaRadius] value, times the [doc://com.apple.modelio/documentation/ModelIO/MDLAreaLight/aspect] value, times two.
- [doc://com.apple.modelio/documentation/ModelIO/MDLLightType/superElliptical]: The light is shaped like a superellipse—a two-dimensional figure in the xy-plane of its local coordinate space that can vary between shapes such as stars, diamonds, circles, and squares with rounded corners. The [doc://com.apple.modelio/documentation/ModelIO/MDLAreaLight/superEllipticPower] property determines the general shape of the light, and the [doc://com.apple.modelio/documentation/ModelIO/MDLAreaLight/aspect] property controls the ratio of the longer and shorter dimensions of the shape.

## Managing a Light’s Shape

- **aspect**: The aspect ratio of the light’s shape.
- **superEllipticPower**: A vector that controls the roundness of a superelliptical light in the x- and y-axis directions.
